titleStmt.title: A most true relation of the affaires of Cleve and Gulick as also of all what hath passed this last summer, since the most excellent and victorious prince, Maurice of Nassau, tooke the field with his armie, encamping before Rees in Cleueland: and the losse of Wesel, taken in by the Marques Spinola: vnto the breaking vp of our armie in the beginning of December last past. 1614. With the articles of the peace, propounded at Santen By Henrie Peacham.
titleStmt.author: Peacham, Henry, 1576?-1643?

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by W. Stansby for Iohn Helme, and are to be sold at his shop in Saint Dunstans Church-yard, vnder the Diall,

notesStmt.note: Claims to correct the account in STC 14838: Newes from Gulick and Cleve.
Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University. Library.

place.placeName: his shop in Saint Dunstans Church-yard, vnder the Diall
